The magnetic flux through the coil is given by Φ = B * A * cos(ωt), where A is the area of the coil and ωt is the angular position of the coil.
The area of the rectangular coil is A = l_AB * l_BC.
The induced electromotive force (EMF) is given by EMF = -n * dΦ/dt.
The rate of change of magnetic flux is dΦ/dt = -B * A * ω * sin(ωt).
Substituting the values, the induced EMF is EMF = n * B * A * ω * sin(ωt).
Plugging in the given values, EMF = 100 * 0.1 * (0.2 * 0.5) * 100π * sin(100πt).
